At my current position, the relevant tiles nearby are:
- (8, 2): empty floor ('.')
- (8, 4): empty floor (previous avatar position)
- (7, 3): master boulder ('$')

Since I still want to make progress toward manipulating the boulders and reaching the goals effectively, I can logically move left to (8, 2) due to the available options or try to interact with the master boulder directly above.

Given that I just moved to position (8, 3), moving left will not strategically align with my goals as moving upward towards the master boulder might yield better interactions.

I will choose to move up to (7, 3) so that I can work with the master boulder on my next turn.
